creator: michael.trindler@id.unizh.ch
text:
(Cocoon 2.1.7 / Lenya 189926 / default publication)

1. (new document "test" created) -> site area / version tab:
->  /test    Current Version    Fri Jun 10 10:19:02 CEST 2005   System

2. (authoring) edit > source editor (and save)
->  /test    Current Version    Fri Jun 10 10:31:07 CEST 2005   alice

3. workflow > submit  -> (still the same info in version tab)

4. workflow > publish
->  /test    Current Version    Fri Jun 10 10:36:35 CEST 2005   alice
Rollback to this version  View  Fri Jun 10 10:31:07 CEST 2005   alice


It looks like <publish> creates a new doc revision. (Of course it does not. This
happens only if I publish the document directly after the first editing.
Probably related with Bug 31968 (no revision created after first editing session.))

creator: edith@apache.org
text:
This bug isn't a duplication of Bug 31968, but instead:

While publishing a document in the default pub the publisher and the
publication's date are set. The document is checked out/in and a backup is made.
The backup has not really a sense, so i remove it.
